Cope harder. Nerva isn’t going away.

>When did you realize that you were NOT going to make it?

They all had generational wealth behind them, and they all operated on insane levels of exploitation to generate that wealth. Realized that "making it" means screwing over so many people that you alienate yourself from most people, except the likes of musk, epstein, trump, etc.
I realized that though the club was small and that I wasn't in it, that the people in the club were not the kind of person I wanted to be. I'd rather disband the club.

then move upwards throughout history and you'll notice the pattern. these people are extremely, extremely religious/spiritual themselves. They are Yahwists.

item.title: Need some serious advice. — 7 replies — 28.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
Need some serious advice.

Open thread • Replies: 7 • Updated: 2026-02-17 19:20 UTC

OP

So I just did a major arbitrage play and earned over 8000 USDT in profit. USDT has long lost its peg on Algorand DeFi, reaching $0.30 due to major exchanges suspending deposits. There were no off-ramps and people simply market sold their USDT for USDC, resulting in a major depeg. However there were still a couple thousand dollars left in USDT liquidity so I found this exchange in South America that still accepted USDT via Algorand Network.

What do I do? As a turd worlder I 3x'ed my $4k portfolio (which was 92% BSV). Do I buy more BSV before it skyrockets to $1200? Do I keep it in USDC? Do I buy a house? By the way I already bought a shitload of furniture for my house and this is for investment.

Early replies (first 3)

61865453
>>61865311
What exchange

61865468
>>61865311
That's not a real USDT idiot

61865684
>>61865453
based retard

>>61865468
it's 100% USDT i outright spent a shitload of on a visa creditcard (bought a new oven and some boating equipment)

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61865721
I would just keep it in USDC. Crypto is circling the drain. When BIP-110 becomes the dominant protocol for Bitcoin, buy Bitcoin.
Is the arb opportunity gone now?

61866565
>>61865721
Yeah it's pretty much over by now. Check vestige.fi.

It might happen again if people take this opportunity to cash out some USDT. I was just lucky I found an exchange that actually accepts these tokens.

Also thanks for the advice.

61866603
Kek, good play OP, thanks for sharing

61866737
>>61865311
>By the way I already bought a shitload of furniture for my house and this is for investment.
THisi s why you're ngmi.

2006 was giving out loans like candy to people who had absolutely no way of ever servicing them
this then resulted in a lot of forced selling into a no bid market as all of this inventory was cleared when the bubble popped

right now we dont have excessive loans, quite the opposite retards arent given insane loans this is legit existing money bidding up hard assets because so much money got printed and it has to go somewhere
you dont get a crash in housing without forced selling and who is going to force sell his real estate at low prices without the bank margin calling them
unlike stocks which are completely fungible and its price is set at the margin, housing isnt and the owner can just sit on the asset forever and not be forced to take any offer being made at market price

to disrupt this 'bubble' you need the government unprinting the money supply (lol, lmao even) or you need a large section of boomers dying off and leaving their heirs with no way to pay the taxes/upkeep and force dump it
the second one is the only realistic option, tho there is also the risk that the heirs can pay for the inheritance and real estate is now permanently locked up in magnate hands and the nation reduced to permarenting slave
